She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as necklaces, bracelets, pendants, etc. 

In the future, Namera would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, a 42-year-old married mother of four, earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, a venture she has been involved in for 12 years. She earns additional income from fish vending.

Vilma is requesting a loan of PHP 50000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario, a married woman who works hard to support her family, has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 10 years. Now requesting a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other equipment, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Magali Del Pilar

texts.es:
Magali es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y con sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, la calidad de vida de la población de esa zona es humilde y muchos no cuentan con los servicios básicos.  

Se dedica desde hace un año a la preparación y venta de alimentos, especialmente pollo frito y postres caseros.  Ella prepara estos alimentos en su domicilio y los vende ahí mismo a sus vecinos y conocidos, ocasionalmente los vende en casa de sus suegros. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades le sirven para ayudar a su esposo, que es peón agrícola, en los gastos del hogar. 

Magali desea adquirir insumos para poder preparar más alimentos y así ampliar su nivel de ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer bastante emprendedora y trabajadora, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
Magali is a 32-year old homemaker who lives with her husband and three children in one of the towns within the agricultural region of Tambogrande.  The quality of life of the residents of this area is humble, and many do not have even basic public utility services.

For the past year, she has dedicated herself to preparing and selling food, especially fried chicken and homemade desserts.  She makes the food in her home, and sells them right there to neighbors and acquaintances, also occasionally selling from her in-law’s house.  The income she makes from these activities helps her husband, who is a farm laborer, with the household’s expenses.

Magali would like to buy supplies to make more food and, therefore, increase her sales levels.  For this reason, she has turned to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles to help her reach her goal.  She is very entrepreneurial, a hard worker, and highly regarded by those who know her.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making more food and increase her level of sales.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 46 years old, married, and has seven children, two who are in school.  She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 29,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Juvy has been raising pigs for five years and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  In the future, Juvy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Nena

texts.en:
Ma. Nena, a 47-year-old married mother of three, works very hard to provide for her family. For 10 years she has been operating a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Now requesting a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, in the future Ma. Nena would like to build and expand her business to secure its financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel tiene  68  años de edad, es separado, y vive junto a sus hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, ubicado en la región Piura. La zona es bastante humilde y sus viviendas son de material rústico, solo cuentan con electricidad.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de quince años. Por un lado posee un terreno de cultivo en donde ha instalado el cultivo de Limón, el cual cosecha con regularidad y por otro lado posee aves de corral en su vivienda, las cuales también comercializa entre sus vecinos. Con estos ingresos el sostiene la economía de su familia. Sus hijos mayores le ayudan en el mantenimiento y cosecha de su sembrío de limón.

Juan Manuel desea adquirir fertilizantes para su plantación de limón, asimismo desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo llevando a cabo varias acciones como la extracción de hierbas dañinas, con esto el se asegura una mejor productividad en su parcela. Para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 4000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is 68 years old, separated, and lives with his children in one of the rural towns within the agricultural district of Tambogrande, located in the Piura region.  This is a poor area, where homes are built from rustic materials and residents only count on electrical services.

For more than fifteen years, he has dedicated himself to work associated with agriculture.  On the one hand, he has farmland where he has planted a lemon crop that he harvests regularly.  On the other, he has poultry that he also sells among his neighbors.  His older children help him with maintaining and harvesting the lemon crop.

Juan Manuel would like to buy fertilizers for his lemon plantings.  Likewise, he wants to provide maintenance for these, such as harmful weed removal to assure a greater production on his parcel.  To meet his goal, he has requested a loan of 4000 Peruvian soles through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
As a married motherr of 12 children, Adelaida works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane and rice.

Adelaida, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF, is requesting a new loan for PHP 12000 to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 27,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 12 years and earns additional income through clothing sales.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to buy a tricycle in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Isata, a married mother of three children aged seven, four, and two years. In 2007, Isata established her plastic dishes business both to earn a living and to enhance her independence. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 720,000 each month.

Isata is now requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy plastic dishes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000.

In the future, Isata plans to own a house and to rent a store in a more strategic area. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic dishes.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria tiene 50 años de edad y vive en Playas. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de víveres y artículos de bazar. El negocio lo empezó hace 15 años atrás cuando se separo de su esposo. Nos cuenta que siempre fue ama de casa y como no había trabajado nunca le fue imposible encontrar trabajo sin referencias. Con ayuda de sus familiares abrió la tienda en la cual tenía pocos artículos, a medida que aumento su clientela fue comprando más productos y poco a poco ha ido aumentando su negocio. El local está ubicado en su domicilio por lo que lo atiende ella todo el día de lunes a domingo. Nos cuenta que al principio fue muy duro ya que tuvo que aprender muchas cosa y sobre todo ganar la confianza de sus proveedores para poder tener créditos, gracias a Dios a quedado muy bien en sus pagos. Como todos sus hijos son mayores de edad vive sola pero si la visitan con regularidad. Con el crédito que solicita va a comprar más productos para ofrecer variedad y aumentar sus ventas. Maria tiene en mente como meta futura construir en su casa varios departamentos para alquilar
texts.en: Maria is 50 years old and she lives in Playas. She runs a shop where she sells food and general store products. She started her activity 15 years ago when she separated from her husband. She told us that she had always been a housewife, and as she had never worked before it was impossible for her to find a job without references. Thanks to her family’s help she opened her shop with few items; she then bought more products as the number of her customers increased, and little by little she has improved her activity. The shop is located in her house, and so she works there all day, Mondays to Sundays. She told us that at first things have been very hard and that she had to learn many things, especially how to win her suppliers’ trust in order to obtain loans, and she thanks God because she has been very good with her repayments. She lives alone because her children are adults, but they regularly come and visit her. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products to offer a wider variety to her customers and to increase her sales. In the future, Maria hopes to build some flats in her house in order to rent them out.

loans.use: To buy food, rice, sugar and home products for her store.

loans.name: Cintia Marilin

texts.es:
Cintia tiene 27 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y a su hija en una de las zonas rurales del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situado en la región Piura. La zona está poblada en su mayoría por agricultores y ganaderos, son gente muy trabajadora, su nivel de vida es bastante precario, solo cuentan con energía eléctrica. 

Ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza y venta de ganado menor, como ovejas, pavos y gallinas. Cintia cría sus animales en ambientes especialmente acondicionados en su domicilio, los alimenta con alimento balanceado, granos y pastos naturales y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes y a los vecinos del lugar. El negocio le brinda ingresos mensuales, los cuales utiliza para ayudar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. El es “mototaxista” (transportista que se vale de un vehículo pequeño motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta a la que se anexa una cabina en la que usualmente se transporta carga o pasajeros). 

Actualmente Cintia desea adquirir alimento balanceado para brindar una mejor crianza a sus animales y obtener mejores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y confiable. Anteriormente ha solicitado un préstamo en Kiva y se encuentra agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron.
texts.en:
Cintia is 27 years old, and she lives with her husband and her daughter in a rural area of Tambogrande, an agricultural district of the Piura region. The inhabitants of the area are mainly farmers and livestock breeders: this is a very hard-working community, and their standard of living is very poor, electricity being the only commodity.

Cintia has been engaged in breeding and selling small animals, such as sheep, turkeys and chickens for many years. Cintia raised her animals at home, in especially fit out pens, and she feeds them with balanced animal feed, grains and natural fodder; once they have reached a good size she sells them to shopkeepers and to neighbors of her area. This activity grants her a monthly income that she uses to help her husband in supporting their family’s economy. Her husband is “mototaxista” (he drives a small motorized vehicle, i.e. a motorcycle with an attached cabin generally used to transport goods or passengers).

Cintia currently wants to buy balanced animal feed to better care for her animals and so to get a better income from her sales. For this reason she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN. She is a reliable and rather responsible woman: she has previously requested a loan through Kiva and she is grateful to the people who have supported her.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed for her animals.

loans.name: Warakoze Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne fait partie du groupe Warakoze et   habite à  Kayanza. Elle est âgée de  45 ans et est mariée à Jérôme, commerçant de chèvre et lapin. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants, âgés  de 13  à 27ans. Seul cadet étudie et vit sous le toit de ses parents.

Elle  fait le commerce de bière Primus et de la bière locale depuis  13 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes  pour la préparation de beaucoup de litres de bière locale, à  vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  continuer son commerce et les gaines du commerce contribueront à la satisfaction ses besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a member of the Warakoze group and lives in Kayanza. She is 45 years old and is married to Jerome, a goat and rabbit merchant. The couple have 7 children together, aged between 13 and 27 years old. The youngest son is the only child who goes to school and still lives with his parents.

Jeanne has been selling Primus beer and local beer for 13 years. This is her 8th loan with Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored credit will increase her capital and she will buy a large quantity of bananas with which to make many litres of local beer for resale, so that she can earn more money. In the coming years, she would like to continue with her business and use the profits to contribute towards taking care of the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas with which to make local beer.

loans.name: Santos Florindo

texts.es:
Santos  tiene 33 años de edad, es  casado, tiene 3 hijos  y vive en el Municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Santos hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de caña de azucar. Santos manifiesta que empezó a trabajar con media manzana, y de la primera cosecha que saco elaboro productos alimenticios como Dulce de azúcar, jugo de caña y batidos para vender, dice que se motivo bastante porque sus ventas fueron muy rentables.  Con el tiempo el fue superándose y ahora cuenta con 2 manzanas de caña cultivadas. 
El solicita un préstamo con ODEF, de 5,000 lempiras para sembrar caña y comprar  fertilizante y mejorar el mantenimiento de los cultivos para lograr sacar mejores cosechas.
Su plan es seguir trabajando y comprar más tierras y poder extender sus cultivos y tener un rendimiento económico que le resuelve todos sus problemas económicos  en el  futuro.
texts.en:
Santos, age 33, is married and has three children. He lives in the Taulabe municipality in Comayagua.

Santos started farming ten years ago.  Specifically, he grows sugar cane.  Santos says that he started to work with half a “manzana” (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres).  He used the first harvest that he got to make food products like fudge, sugar cane juice, and smoothies to sell.  He says that this motivated him because it was very profitable.  In time he was improving, and he now has two manzanas of sugar cane cultivated.

He is requesting a loan from ODEF for 5,000 lempiras to plant sugar cane, to buy fertilizer, and to improve the maintenance of the crops.  He will do this to get better harvests.  His plan is to continue working, to buy more land, to extend his crops, and to have a yield that will solve all of his financial problems in the future.

loans.use: to plant sugar cane, to buy fertilizer, and to improve the maintanence of the crops.

loans.name: Darwin Alexis

texts.es:
Darwin es un joven de 33 años, vive en el distrito de la Tinguiña, el cual se caracteriza porque en él se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, asimismo se le conoce por la generosidad de sus pobladores. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Ceviche. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Derecho.

Con mucho esfuerzo Darwin trabaja en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy conocido por los clientes y sobre todo por su amabilidad.

Darwin está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mejoramiento en su vivienda como resanar rajaduras y pintado de la misma, así de esta manera podrá seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Poder vivir con su esposa que se encuentra en otro país por motivos de trabajo”.
texts.en:
Darwin is a 33-year-old young man from the Tinguiña district, which is known for agriculture, especially cotton. It is also known for the generosity of its citizens. When Darwin has free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors in the area. He also likes to eat his favorite dish, which is Ceviche. Due to his parents' limited economic resources, Darwin only completed secondary school, but he would have liked to study Law.

Darwin works very hard in his business as a motor taxi driver. He works around 10 hours a day and can attend to around 40 customers each day. He thinks his business is going well because he is well known by his customers, especially for his friendliness.

Darwin is very grateful for the Kiva loans. Because of the help they have given them, he will be able to improve his home by patching and painting cracks. This way, he will be able to continue working and fighting each day for his greatest dream: to be able to live with his wife, who lives in another country for work.

loans.use: to improve his home by patching and painting

loans.name: Rukundo Ii Group

texts.fr:
Melance fait partie du groupe Rukundo II et   habite à Kayanza.Il a 34 ans et est marié à Potamie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés d e  4  à 11 ans, dont 3 étudient.
Il  prend soin ses petits frères.

Il fait le commerce de boutique(riz, haricot, sel,…) depuis  18 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de boutique(souliers,huile de beaute, habits,…) à revendre,pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années il  voudrait acheter une parcelle et y construire une maison, voir  ses enfants terminer les études.
texts.en:
Melance is a member of the Rukundo II group and lives in Kayanza. He is 34 years old and is married to Potamie, a farmer. The couple have 5 children together, aged between 4 and 11 years old, 3 of whom study. He also takes care of his little brothers.

Melance has been selling products (e.g. rice, beans and salt) in a shop for 18 years. This is his 2nd loan with Turame. His Kiva-sponsored credit will increase his capital and he will buy many items to resell in his shop (e.g. shoes, beauty oil and clothing) so that he can earn more money. In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land and build a house on it, and watch his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy items for his shop; shoes, beauty oil, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 49 years old and married. She has three children. Zosima works very hard to provide for them.

Zosima runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Zosima has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her store.

In the future Zosima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old, married, and has two children. 

Gina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Gina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila works hard to support her family. Mila is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Mila has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Mila has been in this business for 15 years now. She also earns additional income from dressmaking.

In the future, Mila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 42 years old and widowed with two children. With both her children in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Rosalina has been in this business for six years. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 49 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Rachel works very hard to provide for her family.

Rachel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Rachel has been in this business for 10 years. She sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon, age 26, lives in San Juan Panaon, Misamis Occidental. For the past five years, he has cultivated bananas to support the needs of his only child. He earns  an income of 5,000 PHP a month from this business. 

For a young father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than to see his family in a good living situation. 

Marlon has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He is a new client with GDMPC. 

In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Waly

texts.fr: Monsieur Waly habite au Sénégal. Il est marié et gère un foyer. Il exerce une double activité. Il pratique l’horticulture et en meme temps gère une boutique. Il capitalise une expérience de 20 ans dans l’horticulture. Il consacre l’intégralité de sa journée a ses activités. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un  crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de nouvelles variétés de plantes en vue de développer d'avantage son activité horticole pour mieux satisfaire la demande  de sa clientèle.    Ce financement pourra l’aider à augmenter le nombre de ses employés à 2 et aussi d’accroitre ses gains financiers pour ainsi parvenir à améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son plus grand rêve  est de créer son propre entreprise et   devenir un grand  chef d’entreprise en   horticulture.
texts.en:
Waly lives in Senegal. He is married and runs a household. He has 2 businesses; he has a market garden and also runs a shop. He has 20 years experience in horticulture. He devotes most of his days to his businesses.

Waly is a member of a UIMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 400 000 francs, which he plans to use to buy new varieties of plant, with a view to further developing his horticulture business so that he can better satisfy customer demand. This loan could help him to increase his number of employees to 2, and also to increase his financial gains so that he is able to improve his family's food conditions. His biggest dream is to start his own business and to become a great entrepreneur in the horticulture sector.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Virjie

texts.en:
Verjie is from Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Verjie is married and has four children.

To make a living, Verjie owns and operates a business venture, raising pigs for sale. Verjie been in her business for 14 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Verjie joined GDMPC. Verjie is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba, 36, is married and has three children. Two are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melba has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Melba requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Melba would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ma. Jahelen

texts.en:
Ma. Jahelen is 47 years old and married. She has five children and three are in school. Ma. Jahelen works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Jahelen runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 29 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, shampoo, cooking oil and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

In the future Ma. Jahelen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an Avon products retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more Avon products to sell to her customers.

Rosita has been in this business for 10 years. Rosita earns additional income from raising pigs and from a general store.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more Avon products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Selvia

texts.en:
Selvia, 42, is married and has two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Selvia sells fermented fish and salt in the Philippines. Selvia has been in this business for seven years.

Selvia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of salt and fermented fish to sell.

In the future, Selvia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of salt and fermented fish to sell.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario tiene 63 años, vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano derecha y su compañera en las buenas y malas, juntos tienen 7 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero siempre le brinda su cariño y su amor de padre al igual que ellos a él, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, así como también se encuentra las Líneas de Nazca las cuales reciben a muchos turistas en todo el año, también se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de tuna, algodón, maíz, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho leer y en ocasiones le pide a su esposa que le prepare uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el rico “Seco de Res”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres el solo tuvo estudios primarios, pero le hubiera gustado terminar la escuela y tener una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Nazario se dedica a su sembrío de algodón, el trabaja en su parcela alrededor de 10 horas diarias; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y sobre todo porque Dios siempre está con él y su fe es muy grande.

Nazario está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá abonar su cultivo de algodón y comprara fertilizantes para curar su cultivo de las plagas, así de esta manera podrá tener una buena cosecha, lo que le permitirá tener un mejor ingreso y así seguir trabajando y luchando para seguir adelante y poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener más cultivos”
texts.en:
Nazario, age 63, lives with his wife, who is his right hand and his companion in the good times and the bad times.  Together they have seven children who are now adults.  However, he always gives them his affection and his love as a father, the same as they give to him.  His house is in the city of Nazca, a city known for its hot climate.  You can also find the Nazca Lines in the city (huge drawings in the middle of an arid field that served as a calendar of the rains for the Nazca culture centuries ago), which receives a lot of tourists all year.  Agriculture is developed in Nazca, especially the cultivation of cactus pear, cotton, and corn, among others.

When Nazario has free time he really likes to read.  He sometimes asks his wife to prepare one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Seco de Res” (a traditional Peruvian dish like beef stew).  Due to the few financial resources that his parents had, he only has a primary school education.  However, he would have liked to have finished school and had a university degree.

He enthusiastically devotes himself to his cotton crops.  He works on his parcel of land around ten hours a day.  He believes that it is going very well for him in his business because he is very dedicated, and, above all, because God is always with him, and his faith is very strong.

Nazario is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the support they have given him he will be able to fertilize his cotton.  He will also buy products to cure his crops from pest infestations.  This way he will be able to have a good harvest, and he will have better income.  He will continue working and struggling to get ahead and to be able to fulfill his biggest dream:  To have more crops.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 42 years old and married.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from tricycle transportation.

Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Tedelyn

texts.en:
Tedelyn is 46 years old and single.

Tedelyn runs a general stroe in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Tedelyn has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Tedelyn would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Vilma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Crisilda

texts.en:
Crisilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Crisilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Crisilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married and works hard to support her family. She buys and sells chicharon (pork rinds) in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years.

Cristina has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more chicharon to sell to customers.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more chicharon (fried pork rinds) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 38 years old and married, with one child in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is married and works hard to support her family. She has a tobacco sales business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Primitiva has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more tobacco to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Joventino

texts.en:
Joventino is 24 years old and single. He works hard to provide for his family. Joventino runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Joventino has already borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF. He has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.

Joventino aspires to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande. Este distrito concentra varias localidades con condiciones de vida precarias y humildes y la mayoría no cuentan con todos los servicios básicos. En el caso de Blanca, su vivienda sólo cuenta con energía eléctrica. 

Actualmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, ella cuenta con un grupo de ovejas en su domicilio las cuales cría alimentándolas de pastos naturales. Cuando estas alcancen un peso adecuado las venderá a sus vecinos, a los negociantes de la zona o en el mercado local. Los ingresos que obtenga de esta actividad le permitirán ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Su esposo está a cargo de una parcela en la que tiene instalados cultivos de mango y productos de pan llevar. 

Blanca desea adquirir alimento balanceado para que sus ovejas se desarrollen de mejor modo y pueda obtener mejores ingresos de sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles. 

Ella es bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Anteriormente obtuvo un préstamo financiado por Kiva y gracias a eso pudo mejorar sus ingresos y ventas. Por ello se encuentra bastante agradecida con los prestamistas que le apoyaron en aquella oportunidad.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 53, lives with her husband and her son in one of the settlements that forrms the rural zone in the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  Several places with precarious and humble living conditions are concentrated in this district.  Most of them do not have all of the basic services.  In Blanca’s case, her house only has electricity.

She currently raises and sells sheep.  She has a flock of sheep at her house, and she is raising them and feeding them natural grasses.  When the sheep reach an adequate weight, she sells them to her neighbors, to businessmen in the area, or at the local market.

The income that she gets from this business activity will allow her to help her husband with the financial support of her family.  Her husband is responsible for a parcel of land where he cultivates mango and staples products.

Blanca wishes to get balanced feed for her sheep.  She wants them to develop in a better way, and she wants to be able to get improved income from her sales.  That is why she has believed it appropriate to request a loan for 1,600 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is very responsible and devoted to her family.  She had a previous Kiva loan, and thanks to this she was able to improve her income and her sales.  That is why she is very grateful to the lenders who supported her on that occasion.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her sheep.

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en: Nelyn of Panaon, Misamis, Occidental, has been selling fuel for more than three years and earns 3,570 pesos per month. She’s 40 years old now yet continues to hang on with her business to give adequate support to her family. She's a good member of GDMPC. In order to enhance her business, she is borrowing 5,000 pesos from GDMPC to buy more fuel. Nelyn hopes that someday her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy more fuel for resale.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es un joven de 26 años, a su lado vive su esposa a quien adora mucho y con quien tiene un maravilloso hijo de 2 años de edad, por quien trabaja duro y sobre todo por quien daría la vida ya que es el mejor regalo que Dios le ha podido dar. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad conocida por su clima caluroso, así como también porque su agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio ya que con ello se distrae un poco de los problemas o del mar humor, en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos, solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Mecánica automotriz.

Día a día Jose trabaja con mucho entusiasmo como chofer de mototaxi, ya que al igual que muchas personas en nuestro país no pudo encontrar empleo y este trabajo lo ayuda a poder tener ingresos y llevar el pan para su familia en especial por su niño de 2 años, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, su esposa también lo apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que ella elabora dulces y los vende de manera ambulatoria; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajador y sobre todo es respetuoso y amable.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá darle mantenimiento general a su vehículo, comprar puertas y también podrá comprar un carrito sanguchero para que su esposa pueda trabajar vendiendo hamburguesas, así de esta manera tendrá un vehículo en buen estado y también podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y poder seguir adelante en busca de cumplir su más grande sueño: Tener su casa propia y darle una educación y una vida digna a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Jose is a 26-year-old young man. He lives with his wife, who he loves very much and with whom he has a wonderful 2-year-old son. For his son, he works hard and would give his life because his son is the greatest gift that God has given him. His home is located in the city of Ica, known for its hot climate, as well as for its agriculture, especially cotton, grapes, asparagus, and other products. When he has free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors in the area because it helps to distract him a little from problems or a bad mood. Sometimes, he likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, which is the delicious "Ají de Gallina," or chicken stew. Due to his limited economic resources, he only finished secondary school, but he would have liked to study automotive mechanics.

Every day, Jose works enthusiastically as a motor taxi driver. Much like many people in our country, he could not find employment and this job helps him earn income and bring bread to the table for his family, especially his 2-year-old son. He works around 10 hours a day and can attend to around 20 customers each day. His wife also helps with household expenses by making sweets and selling them. He thinks that his business is going well because he is a hard-worker and, above all, he is respectful and kind. 

Jose is very grateful for Kiva loans because thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to perform general maintenance on his vehicle and buy doors. He will also be able to buy a sandwich trolley so that his wife can work by selling hamburgers. This way, he will have a well-maintained vehicle and will also be able to increase his income, which will allow him to provide a better quality of life for his family and continue forward in hopes of accomplishing his greatest goal: to have his own home and to give his son an education and a decent life.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his vehicle, to buy doors and a sandwich trolley.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз женщина в возрасте но она очень сильная женщина.Она родила и вырастила 10 детей.несколько лет назад у нее муж умер.После кончины мужа она сама женила сыновей и выдала дочерей замуж.Она выращивает скот в течении 40 лет.Сейчас ей помогают в этом ее дети.Выращивают и выводят скот на рынок для продажи.Этот бизнес единственный доход для семьи.Кундуз получает кредит в первые на покупку скота.Она планирует в будущем накопить денег и построить дом для внуков чтобы они не испытывали трудностей как она и  ее дети.Кундуз очень надеется на нашу помощь.
texts.en: Kunduz is an older woman, but she is a very strong person. She gave birth to and brought up 10 children. A few years ago her husband passed away. After her husband’s passing, she herself found the means to pay for her sons’ and daughters’ weddings. She has been raising livestock for  some 40 years. At present her children help her in this business. They fatten livestock and sell at  the market. This business is the sole source of income for the family. Kunduz is receiving her first loan to buy livestock. In the future, she plans to save money and build a house for her grandchildren so that they wouldn’t have  the difficulties she and her children had to face. Kunduz is very much hoping for your help.

loans.use: purchase of livestock for fattening and reselling.

loans.name: Ahadkul

texts.ru: Ахадкул житель города Истаравшан. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Ахадкул занимается торговлей. У него имеется небольшой продуктовый магазин, где он работает продавцом. В этой области Ахадкул восемь лет. Он берет кредит для закупа продуктов и хозяйственных товаров.
texts.en: Ahadkul is a resident of the town of Istaravshan. He is 32 years old, married and has two children. Ahadkul sells goods. He has a small grocery store where he works as a shopkeeper. Ahadkul has been working in this area for eight years. He is taking a loan in order to buy food and household goods.

loans.use: to purchase food and household goods

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, ubicado en la región  Piura. Su vivienda actualmente solo cuenta con el servicio de electricidad. 

Desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino y aves de corral, sus corrales se encuentran en la parte externa de su casa, son apropiados y amplios. Javier alimenta a sus animales con comida balanceada para que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo y así podrá ofrecerlos  a mejores precios. Las ganancias obtenidas son para solventar los gastos diarios de su familia. Adicionalmente, Javier cuenta con una hectárea de terreno (herencia de su padre) en la cual siembra limón para vender en los mercados de su zona. 

Javier ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes con los cuales pueda obtener una buena cosecha y de ese modo obtener mejores ingresos. Javier es una persona trabajadora y responsable que anhela la superación de su familia. El ya ha tenido un crédito con Kiva y se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que le apoyaron en su momento.
texts.en:
Javier, 34 years old, is a family man. He lives with his wife and children in one of the villages in the rural part of the agricultural district of Tambogrande in the Piura region. His house currently has only electricity.

For some years, he has raised and sold sheep and poultry. His pens are in the outside part of his house and are suitable and spacious. Javier feeds his animals balanced feed so that they will reach an optimum size and he will be able to offer them at better prices. The earnings he obtains cover the daily expenses of his family. Additionally, Javier has a hectare of land (inheritance from his father) on which he grows lemons to sell in the markets in his area.

Javier has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles in order to purchase fertilizers, with which he can obtain a good harvest and thus earn more income. Javier is a hard-working and responsible person who longs for his family to overcome. He has already had a loan with Kiva, and he is quite grateful to the people who supported him at that time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to maintain his lemon crop

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is from Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Arlene is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a business venture, cultivating coconuts. Arlene has been in her business for 12 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Arlene joined GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Samnieng

texts.en:
Samnieng (in the photo) is 26 years old and her husband, Hai is 41 years old. They have been married since 2002 and they have two young children- one son and one daughter. The family lives in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Samnieng is a rice farmer, while her husband is a military police. Samnieng is in the process of renovating the house where she lives, but the house is not finished yet. Hence, Samnieng had asked for a loan in the amount of 1,500 USD in order to make the finishes.

loans.use: To finish her house renovating.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie, 43 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Magsaysay, Panaon with 3 children. He is earning from his motorcycle transport service business. It has been started for almost 3 years now and he earns 4,000 PHP a month. To improve business, he borrows an amount of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which he just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Kymbat

texts.ru: Кымбат 48 лет, мать 2 детей.  Кымбат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством. Начатое  с суммы 25,000 сом хозяйство благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Кымбат, на сегодня приносит около 8,500 сом в месяц . В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кымбат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Кымбат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kymbat is a 48-year-old mother of two children. Kymbat is involved in raising animals as the main source of income for her family. 

Begun with a sum of 25,000 som farm, through hard work and perseverance Kymbat currently generates around 8,500 soms per month. In order to further develop her business, Kymbat appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som to purchase livestock -- calves. 

Kymbat plans to use income from the loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Lomas De Yarina", del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 61 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad.
Lleva 2 años trabajando con los préstamos que Manuela Ramos le ha concedido para aumentar su negocia de compra y venta de máquinas de coser usadas y también armazones.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: diversos repuestos para máquinas de coser, 25 bobinas, 15 zapatas, 12 correas para maquina, 50 en arrojadores, 10 zapatitas, 2 maquinas malogradas, 3 armazones  para máquinas de cocer.
Su negocio se ubica en una de las avenidas más transitadas donde está todo el día y todos los días de la semana, se dedica solo a este negocio el cual es el sustento para poder vivir cómodamente, y también está generando trabajo porque cuenta con una persona que le ayuda con la reparación de las maquinas.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de trabajar con los créditos para mejora de su negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the “Las Lomas De Yarina” communal bank of the Yarinacocha district and Ucayali department.  She’s 61 years old, widowed, and has two adult children.

She’s been working for two years with the Manuela Ramos Movement loan program and the loans granted have helped her grow her business, the buying and selling of sewing machines and frames.

With the money from this new loan of 1,000 PEN, she will buy various sewing machine spare parts, 25 bobbins, 15 machine shoes, 12 machine belts, 50 throwers, 10 pads, 2 used machines in need of repair, and 3 sewing machine frames.

Her business is located on one of the busiest streets where she is, every day and every day of the week.  This is her only business, which allows her to live comfortably and also generate work because she has someone who helps her repair the machines.

She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for giving her the opportunity to work with these loans to improve her business.

loans.use: Repuestos de maquina

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 45 years old and has 4 children. Benita is married and has one child who is in school.

Benita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Benita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Benita has been raising pigs for 6 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Benita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
This is Prescila, 41, resident of Dasma, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Noel, and a mother to 3 children. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually send all of them all the way through college.

Prescila oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Prescila hopes to add additional tricycle units someday and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap (pictured with her loom), age 30, is a silk weaver. Her husband, Heun, age 26, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2006 and have two young children- one son and one daughter. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Sopheap is asking for a loan in the amount of 400 USD to assist in her weaving business by buying silk materials.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
This is Antonina, 45, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a driver, and a mother to her six children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. 

Antonina operates a market stall. She sells vegetable produce in their community market. She buys a quantity of vegetables produce and other common items used in cooking and sells them per kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of vegetable produce to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Antonina dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of vegetables needed in her business

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.en: Cleopatra is a widow, 65 years of age, and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental together with her 4 kids. Cleopatra is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 5 years and she earns 5,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Cleopatra wishes that her business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Fifty-two-year-old Virginia is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a fishing business with her husband. Fishing has been her family's source of income for quite some time now. Virginia does her best to increase their daily income. She buys more fish from other fishermen that she can sell at a profit. She requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, nylon and crab traps. Virginia hopes to have better business profitability.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, nylon and crab traps

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en:
Bryan, single, is 24 years of age and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Philippines.

Bryan is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community member to earn a living. He has been doing this for 2 years and every month he earns 5,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

Bryan is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Bryan hopes to gain double income from his business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Carrie

texts.en: Carrie is 25 years old and has 2 young children. She and her partner run a fishing business together. They earn 6,000 PHP per month doing this fishing business. Carrie does her best to manage her time with her livelihood and her children. She requested a loan to purchase additional fishing nets, hooks, lead weights and other materials. This will help bring in more fish for Carrie to sell. In the future, she hopes for their fishing business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, hooks, lead weights and other materials

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy, 38, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Maximino, a government employee, and is a mother of two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nancy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Nancy earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also sells mineral water. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nancy hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have her own house and a lot in a prominent subdivision. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sakina Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Sakina bibi is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, two sons and two daughters. Besides her youngest daughter, the rest are getting an education from a nearby school. 

Sakina herself is illiterate but she doesn’t want  the same destiny to befall her children; that’s why she provides them good education so they can make their future bright and take their life decisions strongly. To bear the education expenses, Sakina does sewing work at her home by getting orders from her neighboring customers.  

Her husband is a businessman and operates a grocery store business in the market where he sells daily-use products at reasonable rates. His customers come to him to purchase items like lentils, cooking oil, rice and soaps, etc. He has been operating his business for many years.  

Sakina has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying groceries in larger quantity to put in his store for sale. Sakina hopes that his business will grow a lot after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Shahnaz Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz bibi is a 37-year-old married lady with four children: one son and three daughters. All of her children are getting an education from a nearby school.  

Shahnaz herself is a very talented lady, who owns and operates a sewing business at her home. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. The income she earns helps her to pay off the education expenses of her children and manage the household expenses. 
 
Her husband is a salesman by profession. He sells eatable items like chips and biscuits to different shops at a profit. He purchases the stock wholesale. He has been in this business for over 5 years and has got a good reputation among his customers. 

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the growth of her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying stock in larger quantity for reselling and increase his profits. She hopes that her husband’s financial position will improve with this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy eatable items (chips and biscuits) for resale

loans.name: Koemlorn

texts.en:
Koemlorn (pictured here), age 49, lives in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers away. She is a widow with two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives separately and another one is a garment worker. 

Koemlorn is hired by her villagers to grow mushrooms and gets paid with fees. She is asking for a Kiva loan in order to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter who is a garment worker to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and has five children. He does carpentry to earn a living. He has been in the business for 12 years. He has employed one person in the business. Peter also does farming to supplement his income. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills. He hopes to grow his business in the future. Peter has requested for 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy timber and nails.

loans.use: To buy timber and nails

loans.name: Sabiti

texts.en:
Sabiti is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to restaurant operators and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the 20,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en: Arsenio, 49 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental with 3 children. He is earning from his transport service business. It has been started for almost 3 years now and he earns 6,000 PHP a month. To improve business, Arsenio borrows an amount of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which he just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainab is a resident of Kisauni, Kenya. She is a fruits and vegetables vendor, a business she has run for 9 years in this coastal town. This area boasts of a large population of people owing to the low income of most residents. Zainab was introduced to Yehu through her friends.

Zainab is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add stocks of fruits and vegetables to her business. Her ambition is to grow the business and start other income-generating activities. Zainab therefore intends to save the extra income obtained from this loan for her future projects.

loans.use: to add stocks of fruits and vegetables to her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in the coastal town of Kisauni, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and runs a retail shop that has been in operation for the last three years. She started the business from her own savings.

Catherine was introduced to Yehu by a friend and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional retail stock such as flour, beans, salt, sugar, etc.

Catherine is optimistic that the income from this loan will help her pay for her children's education. The challenge for her business has been the high cost of goods, a situation she hopes to resolve by purchasing the items in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail stock such as flour, beans, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is from Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occdental. She is 53 years old, widowed and has ten adult-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Theresa is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. Ma. Theresa has been engaged in her business for 4 years and earns 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
 
In 2010, Ma. Theresa joined Kiva partner, GDMPC. Ma. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Fatima Carolina

texts.es:
Fatima es una joven muy trabajadora, sus padres le enseñaron desde muy joven a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente y sobre todo con mucha humildad, tiene 21 años y es muy alegre, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Cuando Fatima tiene un tiempito libre le gusta salir a pasear, sobre todo porque se distrae de lo atariado de su trabajo, en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la pizza, por ella la comería todos los días nos comenta. Estudio la carrera de administración pero debido a que no encontraba trabajo tomo la decisión y sobre todo ahorro y inicio su negocio de venta de Ropa como recorredora. Ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día,  ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo carismática, por ello los clientes siempre le compran sus productos sus productos.

Fatima está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como pantalones, polares, chompas, casacas, entre otros, así de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poder tener mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Fatima is a hardworking young woman. Her parents taught her at a very young age that one should earn a living with the sweat of one's brow and with great humility. Fatima is 21 years old and very cheerful. Her home is located in the city of Ica, which is known for its agriculture, especially its crops of cotton, grapes, asparagus, and other commodities. When she has a little bit of free time, Fatima likes going for walks because it provides a distraction from her work. Sometimes she like to eat one of her favorite foods, pizza, and says that she would eat it every day if she could. Fatima studied for a degree in Management, but she could not find a job in that field. At that point, she made the decision to use all of her savings to start a business selling clothes as a traveling vendor. Fatima works approximately eight hours a day and can serve up to 40 customers each day. She believes she is doing well in her business because she is very friendly with the customers and exhibits her charisma. For this reason, her customers are always willing to buy her products.

Fatima is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business such as trousers, fleece pullovers, sweaters, jackets, and other items. This will improve her earnings and provide her with a wider variety of products to offer to her customers. Fatima will continue to strive for her greatest wish of having a home of her own.

loans.use: to buy trousers, fleece pullovers, sweaters, jackets, and other items.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora tiene 49 años, es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, además de tener muchas ganas de progresar.  Su pareja es Pedro, quien se dedica al comercio y es el padre de sus dos hijos. Vive en compañía de su pareja y el último de sus hijos (de 14 años). Su casa es propia, la cual logró comprar, como mucho esfuerzo, con la ayuda de su pareja.
Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, para eso implementó una tienda en su vivienda con un capital inicial fruto de los ahorros en común que tiene con su pareja. Primero realizó pequeñas compras, logrando vender todos sus productos. Gracias a la buena acogida que tuvo, decidió comprar en mayores cantidades y seguir adelante. Se inició en el negocio hace más de 2 años, tiempo que le valió para hacerse conocida entre sus clientes. Adicionalmente, también se dedica a la compra de autos usados, los arregla y los revende a mayor precio. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es poder contar con un ingreso económico que le sirve para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar.

Este es su quinto préstamo con la institución MFP y está contenta de contar con un apoyo financiero para seguir avanzando con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. 
Con el monto solicitado, de 3000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en mayor volumen, ya que considera que a mayor variedad de stock logrará mayor preferencia de sus clientes. También usará parte del dinero en el pintado y arreglo de un auto usado para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Dora is 49 years old and is a dynamic hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead.  Pedro, her husband is a merchant and the father of her two children.  She lives with her husband and youngest son (age 14).  They own their home, which she managed to buy with great effort, and her husband’s help. 

She is in the grocery business, so she set up a store in her home with her and her husband’s savings.  At first she began with small purchases, succeeding at selling all her merchandise.  Thanks to the nice welcome she had, she began buying larger quantities and moving ahead.  She began this business two years ago, and this time allowed her to become better known to her customers.  She also sells used cars.  She fixes them up and resells them at a profit.  What she likes about her business is being able to count on an income that allows her to help her husband pay the household expenses.

This will be her fifth loan through MFP and she is happy to be able to count on financial support that allows her to get ahead with her business.  She is committed to being on time with her payments, as she was with previous loans.

She will invest the 3,000 PEN in groceries in quantity, and she believes that the larger inventory will help her customers prefer her.  She will also use part of the money to paint and repair a used car for resale.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Pedro Josue

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la pujante ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por la generosidad de su gente y en la cual se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, también se desarrolla la pesca y también tiene una comida exquisita un ejemplo de ellos es el riquísimo Chupe de Camarones, al igual que lo maravilloso de sus playas. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”.

Día a día Pedro trabaja en una empresa de venta de artefactos, este trabajo es un poco duro ya que siempre tiene que estar de pie, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas diarias en las cuales atiende a los clientes que se acercan con mucha amabilidad y sobre todo con mucho respeto y por ello el cree que le va bien en su trabajo, además de que le gusta lo que hace y por ello lo hace con mucho ánimo.

Pedro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como colocar el piso ya que es de tierra, así de esta manera el podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y poder seguir trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Seguir mejorando su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Pedro, 30, lives in the booming city of Camana, a city known for the generosity of its people and its agriculture, especially the cultivation of rice. There is also a fishing industry here, and a delicious cuisine, for example, the delicious "Chupe de Camarones" (Peruvian shrimp chowder).  The area also features marvelous beaches.  When he has free time, Pedro really likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors.  He also enjoys one of his favorite dishes, the rich "Lomo Saltado" (a Peruvian beef dish).

Day by day, Pedro works in a company selling appliances.  This work is somewhat difficult, since he always has to be on foot.  He works about 9 hours each day.  He treats the customers who approach him with friendliness, and most of all, respect, and he believes that this is why he is doing well in his job.  Also, he enjoys what he does, and so does his work with a lot of enthusiasm.

Pedro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing he will be able to make some improvements to his house, such as to put in a floor, since he currently has a dirt floor.  In this way, he will be able to have a better quality of life and continue to work toward his greatest dream: "to continue to improve his house."

loans.use: to improve his house (put in a floor)

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.en: Jhonny is 36 years old, and is married to Emelda, a wife who helps him manage their corn production business. The couple work hard to lift their family up from poverty. Right now, Jhonny is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to sustain his farm. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can sustain the financial needs of his family and save money for the future. He believes that through his patience in managing his farm business he will be able to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to sustain his farm.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, aged 40, is married with three school-aged children. She has a retail shop where she sells different products that she can offer to the community. Maria has had this business for 18 years and she earns approximately PHP 3,000 monthly. Maria is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase a variety of products so that she can offer more products to the community to acquire more customers, thus increasing her income. She wants to buy canned goods, noodles and other daily basic necessities to sell to the community. In the future, Maria hopes that her business will expand to sustain her family's daily needs and also to finance her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles and other daily basic necessities to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a single mother of two. She sells teddy bears to earn a living. She has been in the business since 2008. She also does farming to supplement her income. Ruth has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to grow her business in the future. Ruth has requested for 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy teddy bears for resale.

loans.use: To buy teddy bears for resale

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en: Jenefer is 33 years old and is a married woman with 3 children ages 2, 7 and 11. She runs a store selling dry goods to her community. Jenefer works hard to provide the best service to her customers and keep them loyal to her store. She hopes to expand her business and purchase items that are not in her inventory yet. She requested a loan from CEVI to buy more merchandise to sell such as ready-to-wear clothes and kitchenware. Jenefer hopes for this loan to help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as clothes and kitchenware

loans.name: Marly

texts.en:
Marly is from Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Marly is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Marly owns & operates a retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

 In 2011, Marly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a resident of Kisauni, Kenya and is a clothes seller, a business she has been running for 2 years. She is a married mother of 2 children. She started the business from her husband’s income. He is a mason.

On learning about Yehu from her friends, Mwanapili joined the group members to access loans. She is therefore applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a new stock of dresses, hair clips and trousers. She believes the additional income from this loan will help her pay her children’s school fees. Her ambition is to be an established boutique owner in the region, despite the challenges of seasonal business climate and inflation.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of dresses, hair clips and trousers.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
